snippet: Despite hints that President Obama and House Speaker John A. Boehner might compromise on the tax rate paid by top earners, a host of other tax questions could still derail a fiscal deal.
abstract: Host of knotty tax questions could still derail deal to avert fiscal crisis in Jan 2013, despite hints that Pres Obama and Speaker John A Boehner might compromise on tax rate to be paid by top earners; revenue collected from higher rate on top earners would only be about quarter of $1.6 trillion Obama wants to collect over 10 years.
lead_paragraph: Despite hints that President Obama and House Speaker John A. Boehner might compromise on the tax rate paid by top earners, a host of other tax questions could still derail a fiscal deal.

headline.main: Tax Arithmetic Shows Top Rate Is Just a Starter
headline.print_headline: Tax Arithmetic Shows Top Rate Is Just a Starter
